Job Title: Off Shift Production Supervisor

Location: Chattanooga, TN

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Position: Production Supervisor – Off ShiftLocation: Chattanooga, TN – Greenwood
Position Overview: Production Supervisor directs & coordinates through departmental leaders, activities relative to the production operations. This position is responsible for continuous and efficient production in desired quality and quantity. Ensures objectives are met relative to safety, quality, and delivery.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:Understand and assure compliance of all CM Safety & Health practices.Observe work while being performed and stop production on any operations deemed unsafe.Conduct regular Toolbox Safety Meetings with all direct reports to review safety issues and improve safe working conditions.Train all employees on the safe operations of their machines and on selected safety topics.Investigate all incidents and accidents involving direct reports or reporting departments and make recommendations for corrective action. Implement immediate corrective action where possible.Initiate and perform evaluations of the manning and physical arrangements of the work station (methodizing) on and existing operations to help assure maximum production.Make work assignments to best utilize the resources of the department he/she is leading.Provide required assistance to allow for observation of test conditions including test runs to be performed safely.Train department personnel to be technically and professionally competent.Assist in the development and/or conduct appropriate developmental programs and instructional courses for departmental personnel.Assist the Production Manager in managing labor problems, complaints, resources, etc. exhibiting a high degree of integrity and discretion in dealing with confidential data or information.Participate in fair and consistent problem or complaint resolution and answer suggestions as assigned.Gather information and conduct studies in resolving problems when requested.Provide management support and coordinate department resources to successfully launch new products.Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram or schedule form, i.e. time sheets, production boards. Working knowledge of production machinery operations and capacities. Other duties as assigned by leadership. 
Knowledge, Skills, Competencies, and Abilities:Assure compliance within the departments(s) concerning departmental policies and practices.Maintain the quality of standards and level of standards.Where existing standards are no longer suitable to the jobs for which they have been develop, recommend revisions. Make observations of existing conditions and recommend/resolve, with appropriate levels of management, the method to be used before standards are developed or revised.Accountable to the Production Manager for the quality of support to the Plant and for adherence to department, plant and company policies and administrative procedures. Ability to work independently or as a team.A team player with excellent written and verbal communication skills.Strong organizational skills and detailed oriented.
Required Qualifications:Associate degree with emphasis on Business or Engineering Technology3+ years’ experience in supervision preferably in a manufacturing environment Equivalent combinations of experience and education may be considered
About Columbus McKinnon:Columbus McKinnon is a leading worldwide designer, manufacturer and marketer of intelligent motion solutions that move the world forward and improve lives by efficiently and ergonomically moving, lifting, positioning and securing materials. Key products include hoists, crane components, precision conveyor systems, rigging tools, light rail workstations and digital power and motion control systems. We are focused on commercial and industrial applications that require the safety and quality provided by our superior design and engineering know-how. Columbus McKinnon is a publicly traded company that has been in business for almost 150 years – proud of our heritage, where we come from, and where we’re going. As Columbus McKinnon grows globally, so does our need for driven and inspired employees. Join our winning team!
Columbus McKinnon Corporation promotes a diverse and inclusive workforce and is an Equal Opportunity Employer that does not discriminate against employees or applicants for employment on the basis of race, color, national origin, ancestry, age, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, military or veteran status, marital status, or any other Federal or State legally-protected classes. We also value the safety of all associates and work hard to maintain a Drug Free Workplace.

Experience Level (if available): Associate
